page.title: 15Worksop Bypass
page.content: Construction first began on the bypass in the back end of 1984. To not disrupt traffic flow it must pass under Sparken Hill (the present B6005) in a very deep cutting. For the construction of this large earth movers have been required. Where it crosses the Netherton Road a it was thought better to link it with existing roads by a roundabout. The road to the S of the roundabout is to be improved. Traffic from the S will be diverted from Sparken Hill and Netherton Road (the new B6005) to the bypass. Noise barriers will be erected between the roundabout and the school and along both sides of the bypass through Manton and Windmill lane residential estates. A footbridge will also be built to join Manton with Windmill Lane.
